intro: Mitreola inconspicua, commonly known as the small bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wetlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
